checkers

Class GameLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • checkers.GameLogic

  • public class GameLogic
extends java.lang.Object
    The GameLogic is responsible for the process of one game with the same players. Every game a new GameLogic has to be created. Because it has to communicate with various other objects, it has access to the GUI and the playfield.

    It also includes the static testing methods, which are responsible for the correct execution of the rules.

    Moreover, the GameLogic is running on a different thread to avoid putting too much stress on the main Eventqeue.

    Author:
    Till, Marco

      • makeMove

        public void makeMove(Move m)
        First, the method tests, if the Move transferred as a parameter is valid. After that it executes all nessecary steps for one particular turn.

        Also it is important to know that this method is creating a continous loop with requestMove in a Player. In detail makeMove (actually it is moveRequesting) is calling requestMove in a Player and requestMove is calling makeMove again.

        Parameters:
        m - The Object Move represents a move of one figure on the board. It contains all information needed in order to be fully identified.

      • moveRequesting

        private void moveRequesting()
        MoveRequesting has the task to decide which Player does the next move through the variable inTurn and then calling the requestMove Method of the right Player.

        It is a outsourced method from makeMove and is therefore only called by makeMove. This step ensures a more uncluttered overview over the code.

      • incrementTurnCounter

        private void incrementTurnCounter(Move m)
        This method increments one of the global variables moveCount, after a turn was finished.
        Parameters:
        m - A move.

      • requestDraw

        public void requestDraw()
        This method checks if both players want to accept a draw by calling the method acceptDraw in both player, which returns a boolean.

      • testFinished

        private GameLogic.Situations testFinished()
        It tests if a game has to be finished by certain criterias and then returns the correct situation.

        Returns:
        An enumeration for the passible game situations

      • finishGame

        public void finishGame(GameLogic.Situations end,
                       boolean pFailed)
        FinishGame is only called if a game is certainly going to be finished. It mainly prints all the necessary information to the console. Furthermore, it starts a new game if there are more rounds in this run and resets all variables.

        Parameters:
        end - A variable from the enum situation.
        pFailed - A boolean which is showing if one of the two players lost by doing a wrong move

      • getTwoPlayerMode

        public boolean getTwoPlayerMode()
        This method only returns true, if both players are handled by the same object.

        Returns:
        boolean A boolean which is true if there are two real players.

      • testFigureToKing

        private void testFigureToKing()
        Tests if a figure reached the other side of the playfield. If this is the case, then a method in Playfield is called that changes the figure into a king.

      • testMove

        public static boolean testMove(Move m,
                               Playfield f)
        It tests if the given move is possible on the given playfield. It is static, because it should be possible to access it without instantiating GameLogic.

        Parameters:
        m - The Object Move represents an move of one figure on the board. It contains all information needed in order to be fully identified.
        f - Field is an Object which represents the playfield.
        Returns:
        boolean True, if the move is valid. Otherwise false.

      • testMove

        public boolean testMove(Move move)
        This method is the non static version of testMove. It calls the static method testMove with the current global playfield in the GameLogic.

        Parameters:
        move - the Object Move represents an move of one figure on the board. It contains all information needed in order to be fully identified.
        Returns:
        boolean True, if the move is valid. False, if the move is wrong.

      • getPlayfield

        public Playfield getPlayfield()
        Returns the current global playfield.
        Returns:
        field

      • linkGUI

        public void linkGUI(GUI gui)
        The GameLogic needs the current graphical interface in order to output something to the console. Here the parameter is set as the current gui.

        Parameters:
        gui - The graphical interface which is responsible for creating the window and displaying the right playfield and console

      • setSlowness

        public void setSlowness(int pSlowness)
        This method sets the time of the pauses between the moves in milliseconds.

        Parameters:
        pSlowness - An Integer that holds the time between the individual moves in ms.

      • setPause

        public void setPause(boolean b)
        This method is responsible for pausing and continuing the current run. If the game is running an this called then the global boolean variable pause is set to true, so in the next turn the loop between makeMove and moveRequest in player will be interrupted.

        If the game is already paused the method moveRequesting is called.

        Parameters:
        b - The boolean variable is true if the game will be paused. If the game is already pause, it is false.

      • getFinalSituation

        public GameLogic.Situations getFinalSituation()
        This method returns a global variable which represents the final situation of a game. It is especially needed when saving the game information.

        Returns:
        endSituation a variable from the enumeration Situations.

      • getFailed

        public boolean getFailed()
        It is especially needed to save the game information.

        Returns:
        failed A boolean which shows if a game was finished by a wrong Move made by a Player.

      • isInProgress

        public boolean isInProgress()
        Returns:
        gameInProgress Returns true if a game is running, otherwise false.

        public void setManager(EvaluationManager manager)
